resources.string: Choosing too large an array size, coupled with a choice of too high read speeds, can cause application errors.

A fast Fourier transform (FFT) algorithm computes the discrete Fourier transform (DFT) of a sequence, or its inverse (IFFT). Fourier analysis converts a signal from its original domain (often time or space) to a representation in the frequency domain and vice versa.

JTransforms is the first, open source, multithreaded FFT library written in pure Java. The code is derived from General Purpose FFT Package written by Takuya Ooura and from Java FFTPack written by Baoshe Zhang.\nSource: https://sites.google.com/site/piotrwendykier/software/jtransforms
algs4 is library edited by Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayne surveys the most important algorithms and data structures in use today.\nSource: http://algs4.cs.princeton.edu/home
************ X Axis ************\n Reads from sensor / Reads after IFFT / Diffrence\n
************ Y Axis ************\n Reads from sensor / Reads after IFFT / Diffrence\n
************ Z Axis ************\n Reads from sensor / Reads after IFFT / Diffrence\n
